thread.title: Maine town gets 30 inches of snow
thread.title_full: Maine town gets 30 inches of snow

title: Maine town gets 30 inches of snow
text:
Maine town gets 30 inches of snow Maine town gets 30 inches of snow By The Associated Press February 13, 2017 The National Weather Service says the Maine town of Cary has recorded 30 inches of snow during the past 24 hours. It’s one of several towns in the state that will remember the latest winter storm mostly for the massive amounts of snow they received. Highest snowfall report of 30" at the small town of Cary Plantation. Numerous reports around 2 feet now. #mewx 
— NWS Caribou (@NWSCaribou) February 13, 2017 Cary is near the Canadian border and has registered the most snow in Maine from the storm that still was active Monday evening. But there were several towns not far behind, including Dexter, which got 28 inches, and Island Falls, which logged 25 inches. Meteorologists say some towns see similarly high snowfall totals every few years. And the numbers still can rise. The storm is expected to continue on for several more hours before petering out Monday evening. Advertisement
